attributes.action: To legalise handguns for fac holders
attributes.background: I believe that legitimate gun owners should be able to shoot a handgun because Northern Ireland do and so does the Isle of Man and jersey. You can say guns will increase violent crime but Switzerland has 1 gun per 2 people and have a lower crime rate than us. Fac holders should be able to do this to
attributes.additional_details: This will mean fac holders can own handguns for target shooting and self defence like Northern Ireland

attributes.action: Stop electoral fraud by creating a national database of voters
attributes.background: There is insufficient rigour applied to the voting process and it is open to error and fraud because it is not national, has insufficient identity checks on an individual, and does not include an individualâ€™s voting rights. A national database and appropriate identity checks would resolve this.
attributes.additional_details:
An individual, e.g. student or home-owner, may have two places of residence, in different local authorities. They are entitled to vote in both local authority elections but by law they are only allowed to vote once in a national election.
The individual does not have to specify at which residence they would like to cast their national vote, so they receive two polling cards and whilst it is illegal to vote twice there is no validation carried out to stop this.

attributes.action: End the Help to Buy scheme and instead direct this funding into social housing
attributes.background: The UK government's funding of the Help to Buy scheme constitutes a fundamental misuse of public funds and fails to deliver the much needed affordable housing for the people of the UK. Property developers are profiteering at the nation's expense whilst failing to provide homes we so desperately need

attributes.action: Amend PIP rules so that mentally disabled adults can get a Blue Parking Badge.
attributes.background: Currently rules on Personal Independence Payments mean that mobility points, which allow people to access a Blue Badge for disability parking, are allocated on physical capacity to walk, only, not a mental impairment. This is demonstrably unrealistic and impacts people with disabilities and carers
attributes.additional_details: My learning disabled daughter Emily can physically walk but this doesn't mean she can always do so safely. My mum had dementia, she was able to walk but unable to appreciate the dangers around her. A Blue Badge is a passport to understanding and to life. To refuse to allocate a blue badge, unless a person's ability to walk is affected, is morally and factually wrong.This needs to be addressed and urgently amended, so that all disabled people are treated equally by the authorities and by society.

attributes.action: Voluntary Right to Buy (VRTB) Scheme for Housing Associations - Update Needed
attributes.background: This petition calls for an update from UK government on the Voluntary Right to Buy Scheme which proposes for the Right to Buy to be extended to Housing Association tenants in England (as pledged in Conservative Manifesto in 2015, piloted with 5 associations and gaining Royal Assent in 2016).
attributes.additional_details:
The government should confirm intentions to deliver the scheme nationally as pledged in 2015. Detail is needed on the timeline for when the scheme will be rolled out nationally, and what the criteria will be for those wishing to apply to purchase their home. 

www.twitter.com/RTBforHA
www.facebook.com/RTBforHA/

attributes.action: Having knocked over a cat, the driver must legally stop to help/trace the owner
attributes.background: We have lost two cats to road traffic accidents. On both occasions the drivers did not stop to check if the cat could be saved. It is a criminal offence not to stop and report an accident involving a dog. Whilst cats are more independent they are still a beloved pet and should be respected equally.

attributes.action: Investigate covert foreign interference in the EU referendum
attributes.background:
It is becoming clear that the US 2016 election was the target of Russian efforts to influence the result, for instance via large numbers of fake social media accounts.

There is some evidence (eg http://ind.pn/2wuMo48 ) that the EU referendum was similarly targeted; a full investigation is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important that the full scale of any manipulation is made public, so that trust in democracy in the UK is restored and necessary precautions can be developed.

It is noteworthy that in the US/German cases, spreading fear of immigrants has been a major tactic (http://nyti.ms/2xonxTw)

German BfV statement: (16 Nov 2016) http://reut.rs/2gZS17j

The Fake Americans Russia Created to Influence the Election (7 Sep 2017) http://nyti.ms/2wflmT6

EU referendum: (14 Dec 2016) http://ind.pn/2i2Jeh5

attributes.action: Establish an independent body to fact-check the things said during campaigning
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaining world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending Â£350 million a week to the EU; we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new department should consist of teams from Ofcom, Advertising Agency, CPS, ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Provide free glasses on the NHS, for children with Irlens Syndrome.
attributes.background: Like many children with Irlens Syndrome, my daughter struggles to read. The words and letters "move around the page". This is not actually an optical problem but a problem with the way the brain processes visual information, and can be stopped by simply putting a coloured filter over the words.
attributes.additional_details:
It's possible to get a tinted sheet to lay over her work but this has to be removed for writing. 

To flourish at school she needs glasses with the correct coloured lenses so that she can see her work. They aren't available on the NHS as the prescription is a colour, not curved glass, leaving the parent to pay for a colourimetry test to find the correct shade and depth of colour, the frame and the lenses, costing about Â£250+ plus regular assessments.

To read, write and reach their potential these children NEED their glasses but are penalised due to their prescription. Glasses for Irlens Syndrome are vital to their education and should be provided on the NHS just like any other children's glasses.

attributes.action: UK retailers to label all meat non-halal or halal so all religions have a choice
attributes.background: We want clearer labelling on all meat, including chicken. As most British meat does not state whether the meat is halal or non halal(haram). We want meat clearly labelled for all faiths and ethical backgrounds. So Christians, Muslim, Jewish, Sikh, etc should all have a choice in what meat they eat.
attributes.additional_details: We know people of all faiths, and have problems finding out whether the meat is non-halal or halal, as there is nothing stated on the packaging in British supermarkets/butchers. We think it is only fair that everyone of every faith should know which way the meat is slaughtered so everyone has a choice in what they are eating. There are no guidelines for consumers in making this choice for all ethical reasons. We want to see clearer labelling on every meat and chicken product sold in the UK.

attributes.action: Change the law so that all dogs have to be on a lead in public areas
attributes.background:
On April 22nd 2016 my grandson Anton was horrifically attacked by a neighbours pet dog, the dog was not on a lead as the owner set out to walk it. It grabbed my grandson causing severe injuries. 
I see way too often dog owners walking with their dogs in public areas without the dog being on a lead.
attributes.additional_details: How many more children are going to be scared for life or even killed before we act? If dog owners cannot take responsibility for owning a dog then the people who are elected to keep us safe must act for our us and our children. All dogs in any public areas should be on a lead. Dog owners of which I am one need to be more responsible and understand dogs can and do kill. If you are out with your dog be understanding there maybe other children like Anton scared of your dog.

attributes.action: Reform the UK Voting System - Adopt Proportional Representation
attributes.background: We call for a new debate & Vote into replacing the current First Past The Post system with Proportional Representation. FPTP is out-dated & only benefits the larger, more established parties. It is unfit for the modern times. PR allows for the views of the country to be more accurately representated
attributes.additional_details: We ask the government not to dismiss this petition as they have done before, as whilst there was a vote in 2011, with only a 42% turnout (& was described by political scientist Iain McLean as "bad-tempered & ill-informed public debate") ; We believe opinions and the political landscape has now changed, so before you reject this, Please do additional research this year and next, such as with YouGov, & social media and if opinions have changed, as we believe, hence this petition, hold a new vote!

attributes.action: Introduce the British Empire as a mandatory part of the Key Stage 3 curriculum
attributes.background: Currently the British Empire is an optional and small footnote on the History syllabus. A thorough and balanced mandatory module should be introduced to proportionally reflect the impact the Empire has had on our diverse UK population, and its impact on public attitudes towards immigration and race.

attributes.action: A review for tougher sentences for all of One Punch assaults and fatalities
attributes.background:
The law states that one punch assaults are sentenced to GBH which is up to 5yrs but usually get 2.5yrs. 
Manslaughter which is up to 10yrs but get 3 to 5yrs. 
The sentence does not reflect the severity of the damage that is caused by a one punch assault.
attributes.additional_details:
A review for tougher sentences for all of one punch assaults and fatalities. 
The law states that one punch assaults are sentenced to GBH which is up to 5yrs but usually get 2.5yrs. 
The sentence does not reflect the severity of the damage that is caused by a one punch assault: 
â€¢ Death 
â€¢ Catastrophic brain injury 
â€¢ Long slow recovery rate 
â€¢ Huge effect on victims , families, friends, community

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave from 2 weeks to at least 4
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time to help with the mother and bond with the baby. 4 weeks should easily be the minimum to give dad's a better chance to bond and give the mother more support.
attributes.additional_details:
Men suffer from postnatal depression too. I did, and I went sick for 4 weeks. Having these extra weeks helped me bond with the baby instead of never seeing her due to work. Here's my story:

https://youtu.be/mt-yyjEotE0

This is something that benefits both the mother and the father, and is incredibly important for bonding in the early stages of a babies life.

attributes.action: To retract the Â£1bn DUP deal and use the money across the whole United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Conservative Party promised Â£1bn to Northern Ireland as part of a deal to secure a majority government with the Democratic Unionist Party. This deal should be suspended and the Â£1bn should be spent  across the whole of the UK, not to prop up a Parliamentary majority.

attributes.action: Cyclist should be subjected to a CBT type training prior to using the highways.
attributes.background: Many cycle deaths are a result of improper road knowledge of cyclists. Cyclist, like scooter riders should be subjected to a basic compulsory training session to use the public highways. This will generate revenue for the government as well as reduce cycle fatalities.
attributes.additional_details: I am a cyclist and have completed training with my local authority. I was amazed to learn how much at risk we are when we make small mistakes e.g. Speeding, not indicating or being on the wrong lane or even, when we overtake other cyclists.

attributes.action: Theresa May to publicly condemn the government of Myanmar/Burma
attributes.background: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres said the Rohingyas were facing a catastrophic humanitarian situation, and attacks on villagers were unacceptable. The UN Security Council has called for urgent steps to end the violence.
attributes.additional_details: Amnesty said it had new evidence based on satellite imagery, photos and videos, as well as interviews with eye-witnesses, of "an orchestrated campaign of systematic burnings" targeting Rohingya villages for almost three weeks. "The evidence is irrefutable - the Myanmar security forces are setting northern Rakhine State ablaze in a targeted campaign to push the Rohingya people out of Myanmar. Make no mistake: this is ethnic cleansing," said Tirana Hassan, the group's crisis response director.

attributes.action: Stop police and crime commissioners from controlling the fire brigade.
attributes.background: The Police and Crime Act 2017 gave the police and crime commissioner the ability to apply to the Home Secretary to take democratic control of a county fire service. We the undersigned ask that this power be repealed as undemocratic. Firefighters should be represented by local councillors.
attributes.additional_details: One police and crime commissioner cannot adequately represent an entire county fire service. When a decision of this type is made it is decided on economics alone. This fails to consider factors such as whether firefighters have been consulted on potential changes to their duties. Many such applications are made with a clear desire to merge Police and fire services. This would mean a drastic change in job role without any debate or consultation at the local council.

attributes.action: Grant the Welsh Assembly the same powers as Scotland currently has.
attributes.background: The Welsh Assembly has been campaigning for greater devolved powers for years, and yet hasn't received any. It's only fair that all the nations should have equal powers devolved to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/magazine/give-the-welsh-more-power

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-politics-38643532

attributes.action: Improve allergen labelling on food packaging.
attributes.background:
8% of children and 2% of adults have one or more potentially life threatening food allergies (not intolerances), yet labelling is unclear.
Food should be labelled with:
the front of packaging should have icons to show the type of allergen*. 
The back should list all allergens separately.
attributes.additional_details:
May contains statements are currently optional - leaving people unsure if food is safe. They should be mandatory where there is a genuine risk of cross contamination. Even a small amount of allergen can be fatal.

Currently allergens are made bold in the main ingredients list. Allergy sufferers and their carers have to carefully examine the ingredients to spot them.

Sources:
https://www.anaphylaxis.org.uk/

*Icons for allergens:
http://www.erudus.com/standardised-food-allergy-icons/

attributes.action: Change the law in England to "opt out" for organ donations
attributes.background: In England, Scotland and Northern Ireland, your organs and tissue will only be used if you have given consent.  Wales changed to "opt out" in 2015 and Scotland is considering it.  England and NI rely on public awareness campaigns.
attributes.additional_details: In the first six months after the law change, there was a 38% reduction in the number of people in Wales waiting for a transplant.  Just 36% of people in the UK are now on the NHS Organ Donor Register, compared with 30% five years ago.  According to a recent BBC article http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-40564329  457 people died last year while on the waiting list, as they did not get a donor organ in time.  875 people became too ill to undergo transplant surgery.

attributes.action: We urge the government to reclassify medical negligence as a criminal matter
attributes.background: Too many cases of medical negligence are classed as a civil case and therefore the police are not required to investigate doctors involved. Any other profession causing death by neglect would be fully investigated by the police and handed to the crown prosecution service to determine charges.
attributes.additional_details: When doctors neglect patients they should be treated in the same way as any other profession research harry prockos case

attributes.action: Bring home the last dambusters Lancaster bomber.
attributes.background: We would like the British government to bring the wreckage of "Easy Elsie" the last lancaster bomber from 617 squadron - (the dambusters) back to the UK. She crash landed in in a swamp in Porjus, Sweden on 29-10-1944 after attempting to sink the Tirpitz. All of Elsie's crew survived.
attributes.additional_details: She currently lies outside, open to the elements, while slowly rotting and being scavenged by souvenir hunters. We believe this historic and unique piece of British military heritage should be returned home, preserved and used to educate this and future generations about the bravery and sacrifice made by our ancestors during world war 2.

attributes.action: In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment
attributes.background:
It is a condition of membership of the EU that all member states do not practice capital punishment.

When we are finally free of the EU the people should be allowed a referendum to reinstate capital punishment.

attributes.action: The undersigned demand the following terms are included in any UK Brexit deal.
attributes.background: To include a deduction for the value of the UKâ€™s share of funds held by the European Investment bank, EU loans, EU properties, cash and any other EU investments and assets, the total of which will offset any financial payment(s) made to the EU in whatever form as part of our final Brexit agreement.

attributes.action: Smart Brexit:  Apply to rejoin EFTA
attributes.background: A 'hard Brexit' is a nightmare scenario for the UK, in which jobs and trade will suffer catastrophically. However, the U.K. can maintain free trade with the EU by applying to European Free Trade Association (EFTA) Council to rejoin EFTA and regain powers to write trade deals with non EU countries.
attributes.additional_details: The EFTA countries enjoy unparalleled access to EU goods and services markets. EFTA citizens enjoy free movement across EEA/EU states. EFTA States have 27 free trade agreements, covering 38 countries including Canada, and are close to signing an FTA with India. In addition, EFTA is outside the EU foreign, justice, agriculture and fisheries policies. Overall, reductions in net cost to the UK have been estimated at between 17% and 60% of current payments.

attributes.action: Close anticlock sliproad M25 junction 1b to stop drivers cutting from junction 2
attributes.background: The anticlockwise slip road at junction 1b is used as cut through when the M25 traffic is bad. This then blocks the flow of traffic in and around Dartford resulting in major conjestion and air/noise pollution in the local area.
attributes.additional_details: The local authority have stated that they cannot install or police a box junction. If a box junction was to be installed it will likely be ignored anyway. Access to the M25 could be maintained via the junction and roundabouts at junction 2

attributes.action: Make Bullying a Criminal Offence
attributes.background: Bullying ruins the life of victims. Sadly, it is a daily occurrence for some schoolchildren and is sometimes so severe that victims self-harm, lose out on schooling, or even like my son Brandon take their own life.
attributes.additional_details: The police in my son's case refused to investigate as my son was not attending school. This cannot be right. I call upon the Government to urgently produce guidelines for the investigation of and prosecution of offences which arise out of bullying and to plug the gaps in the law where the victim has been harmed due to bullying, which is not recognised as an offence. Without penalties being imposed there is no guarantee that others won't be hurt.'Â

attributes.action: Zero hours contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices.
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: Suspend UK training the Burmese Armed Forces.
attributes.background: In 2017 the Burmese Armed Forces did something called Ethnic Cleansing to the Rohingya Muslims. Ethnic Cleansing is when they remove an ethnicity from their territory. It comes in forms like deportation and, in severe cases, mass murder and genocidal rape. Last year UK funded the Burma Army Â£305K.
attributes.additional_details: So far the Armed Forces have killed more than 1000 Muslims and 200,000 Muslims have been displaced from their homes and fled to other countries. They have also raped some women and have burnt people's homes. We the people paid the government so that they can make good use of it. We want them to stop funding the Burmese Armed Forces because of the actions they have done to the Muslims. Imagine if you were a 5yr old innocent child, you had fled to Bangladesh and your family had recently died. So please take action in Myanmar.

attributes.action: Change the rules to allow gay men to donate blood more freely.
attributes.background: NHS has been crying out for people to donate more blood. Yet as a gay man I cannot do this as easily as others mainly due to the restrictions in place. Having to abstain from sex for 3 months as of 2018 is still not good enough. Gay men want to help save lives too. Help change the rules. Equality.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.blood.co.uk/who-can-give-blood/men-who-have-sex-with-men/

attributes.action: Create a campaign to raise awareness of the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background: The number of young people being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes is rising at an alarming rate. The symptoms are often missed or explained away as flu. If left undiagnosed the outcome is fatal. If diagnosis is delayed the result is life changing. We need a campaign to highlight the symptoms.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.news-medical.net/news/2007/03/19/22619.aspx

https://www.diabetes.org.uk/About_us/News_Landing_Page/UK-has-worlds-5th-highest-rate-of-Type-1-diabetes-in-children/

The statistics are frightening.
We need to raise awareness of the symptoms like we have had with meningitis and more recently sepsis.

attributes.action: Political Education to be put on the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: We are told how important it is to vote and to be politically aware so why isn't politics on the National Curriculum? We should be taught the importance of being able to vote and the history behind it, how party's differ and how our Parliament is made.

attributes.action: Abolish prescription charges
attributes.background: England is the only part of the UK who still charges prescription charges. Prescription charges make medications unaffordable. The Prescription Charges Coalition found that 1 in 3 people with a long term condition who paid for their medications did not pick up their medication due to costs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.prescriptionchargescoalition.org.uk/uploads/1/2/7/5/12754304/still_paying_the_price_june_2017.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide deposit return system for plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: We call for the UK-wide introduction of a deposit return scheme for drinks bottles and cans. While Scotland is planning such a scheme, the rest of the country must not fall behind. Given the near-ubiquitous plastic pollution of oceans and land environments, urgent action is required by the whole UK.
attributes.additional_details: Worldwide, 8 million tonnes of plastic leaks into the oceans annually, where it fragments into ever-smaller particles. According to scientific studies, it can now be found in the guts of 90% of seabirds, in 1/3 of UK-caught fish, and even in tap water. Urgent action is needed. Of the 35 million plastic bottles discarded daily by British households, almost half do not get recycled. Many countries already have deposit return schemes. In the German one, over 97% of PET plastic bottles get recycled.

attributes.action: When a defendant makes a plea in a sexual case, the jury should be made aware
attributes.background: Three girls were raped. When the case went to Crown Court, the rapist offered to plead guilty saying that he used his fingers and not his private part. The girls rejected the plea and, to the horror of all 13 witnesses, he was found not guilty. The jury should have known he offered a guilty plea.
attributes.additional_details: In future, when a defendant makes a plea in a case of sexual violence, the jury should be told

attributes.action: I want everybody to have the chance to have one free try of IVF on the NHS
attributes.background: I think its wrong how some people cannot have children through natural reasons but they have to pay for IVF. For example, a couple and say the man has previous children they have to pay then. This is unfair for the woman when people can get nose jobs etc on the NHS its unfair and it needs to change.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details: It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped.

attributes.action: Prevent President Buhari and all state Governors of Nigeria from entering the UK
attributes.background: Nigerian Government troops have entered SE Nigeria under Python Dance II. It's an act of provocation. The UK Government must act by banning President Buhari and all state governors of Nigeria from entering the UK.

attributes.action: Make Student Nurses and Midwives eligible for 30 hours free childcare
attributes.background: Earlier in the year, the government introduced 30 hours of free childcare for 3-4 year olds in the UK. It has since emerged that this scheme ignores the workforce of Student Nurses and Midwives with children who work 30+ hours in the NHS, who are now without a bursary and have limited support.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Student Nurse and Midwifery applications fell by a staggering 23% after the abolition of NHS Bursaries. These students now need to take out loans and take up second jobs in order to make ends meet. This is even harder for students with children and often forces them to drop out after the first year of training.
There are 24,000 nursing posts in the UK which need filling. This is a change that could benefit thousands of Student Nurses and Midwives, and help fill those vacancies.

attributes.action: All high-rise tower blocks over 30 metres must have sprinklers installed.
attributes.background: Sprinklers save the lives of tower block residents and firefighters. Lives could have been saved in the fatal fires at Grenfell Tower and Lakanal House in London, and at Shirley Towers in Southampton. The new law should include a duty on local authorities and the local fire service to enforce.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2013, the Coroner of the Shirley Towers fire recommended that:
"Social housing providers should be encouraged to consider the retrofitting of sprinklers in all existing high-rise buildings in excess of 30 metres in height." Fire experts recommend sprinklers too. Yet in all this time, seven years after Shirley Towers, councils and housing providers have failed to install sprinklers. We should not wait for the Grenfell Tower investigations to complete. The law must change NOW.

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
In 2014 the public sector spent 140 million on translation services; 2017 will be considerably more.
Local councils spent at least Â£25m; the police Â£21m; the courts system spent more than Â£10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS â€“ a conservative estimate was Â£55m.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.

There are far too many foreign nationals settled in the UK long term that do not or refuse to integrate fully into our society by not learning to read and write in our native languages.

Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Make the DNA testing of dogs compulsory in order to compile a national database
attributes.background: The DNA testing of dog mess is already offered by some companies and could be used to find a dog owner guilty of such an offence. The problem is there is no database for the DNA of dogs, and owners are not obliged by law to register them. A database would allow an unequivocal conviction to be made.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for councils to provide essential public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the country council are closing public toilets in cost cutting measures but these decision are unfair on certain sections of our society, especially young and disabled persons. It is a natural requirement for us all to use the toilets and facilities should be made available where needed.
attributes.additional_details: At public open spaces where public toilets have been removed this has discriminated against those who are now unable to benefit from the health and well being these open spaces provide because of their need to use the a toilet. Discriminating against any section of society is unlawful in both UK and EU law but this has not deterred councils for closing public toilets. If legislation were created then they would no longer be able to use the excuse, "We have no legal requirement to provide them"

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all new building developments incorporate solar panels
attributes.background: There is a requirement for alternative energy, and given the number of new houses required moving forward, this would be an ideal strategy to help alleviate the use of fossil and nuclear energy.
attributes.additional_details: It would also be easier to connect to the national grid at the build stage rather than having to retro-fit at a later stage. it would also help increase the solar power industry.

attributes.action: Lower the cervical smear test age to 18!
attributes.background: We want to lower the age of smear tests from 25 to 18. If we cannot lower it to 18 we should at least let girls from 18 be allowed to get a test if they so wish!
attributes.additional_details: Every 2 in 100 girls that are diagnosed are under the age of 25. If there is history in the family of cervical cancer I believe girls should be aloud to be tested and not have to wait until they are 25! Please see sense! Sign this petition so that we may help others and potentially our children or our children's children in the future!

attributes.action: Use foreign aid money to help in the Caribbean.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous not to use our foreign aid budget to help in the Caribbean, let common sense prevail and quickly.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/853897/Hurricane-Irma-UK-British-overseas-territory-foreign-aid-Boris-Johnson-Theresa-May

attributes.action: Give PCV licence holders category C1 licence aswell.
attributes.background: PCV holders or category D licence holders are able to drive any size bus e.g double deckers and bendy buses which can weigh in excess of 18 tonnes but cannot drive a vehicle which weighs less than half of this.
attributes.additional_details: Driving people around in a bus or coach is much more difficult than driving a small lorry half the size of the vehicles I can drive which weighs up to 7.5 tonnes. Even to drive certain vans which can weigh 4.2 tonnes cannot be done if classed as a normal van but if classed as a minibus it can be driven but the size is no different and neither are the tachograph laws.

attributes.action: Cyclists must take a road test, be Licensed and Insured to be on the road.
attributes.background: In light of the recent deaths involving cyclists causing harm or even death to pedestrian or themselves, please sign this petition so that it becomes a legal requirement to undertake a road safety test so to gain license and also have insurance like every other user on the roads.
